testcase.name: CSV Import - No conflict
testcase.summary: Import a CVS that has a contain that assure no conflict will be generated by import. Fill User interface in following way: Leave combo "Set conflict solution" with it's default value [ ] Do not import items with empty Scope

testcase.name: CVS Import - CONFLICT - UPDATE
testcase.summary: Re-Import a CVS file, in this way you will create a conflict. Fill User interface in following way: combo "Set conflict solution" => UPDATE [ ] Do not import items with empty Scope

testcase.name: CVS Import - CONFLICT - SKIP
testcase.summary: Re-Import a CVS file, in this way you will create a conflict. Fill User interface in following way: combo "Set conflict solution" => SKIP [ ] Do not import items with empty Scope

testsuite.name: Search Test Cases - Simple from TOP MENU BAR
Test Case Assignment to TEST PLAN

testcase.name: Assign test case and also tester on same operation

step.actions:
Login to test link

Create a test project

Create Test Spec importing using sample present on

[TL install dir]\docs\qa_data\simple_with_platforms\testproject-2ts-4tc.xml
step.expectedresults: test spec with two test suites each with a child test suite, with two test cases inside each childe test suite

step.actions:
Create at least 4 users (you can use SQL script present on

[TL_install_dir]\docs\qa_data\formula_one.sql or formula_one_mysql.sql)
step.expectedresults: 4 user + admin user

step.actions:
Create test plan PLAN-5111

Create build 1.0

Use link on main screen ' Add / Remove Test Cases'

select child test suite

on right screen check first test case,

select a use and a build

(see attached image screen before ...)
Click button 'Add / Remove selected'
step.expectedresults:
after submit you will see NO INFO ABOUT tester assignment,

but row with selected test case on step 4, will change color to yellow (see screen AFTER ....)

step.actions:
Go to feature ' Assign Test Case Execution'

look for test case used on step 4
step.expectedresults:
you will see that user is assigned

(see image screen of Assign Execution feature)

testcase.name: Test case assignment - Assigned to filter - scenario #1
testcase.summary:
Create a Test Plan
Create some Test Cases and add it to the Test Plan

Create 2 Builds B1 and B2.

In Build B1 - assign test cases to User A and User B

User A executes the test cases as below in build B1

Pass - 5
Failed - 3
Not Run - 8

User B executes the test cases as below in build B1

Pass - 8
Failed - 2
Not Run - 4

Now I need to assign the test cases to the build B2 for following requirements:
1: Add all not run test cases: This part works using the filters.
2: Add all the Pass test cases which were assigned to User A in the build B1 the test cases returned are incorrect.

The Filters I set for this are as follow:
Build to Assign : B2

Assigned to : User A
Status: Passed in specific build B1.

I hope this is clear. Let me know if any doubts.

You can try testing with other status values . They also return incrrect values or 0 test cases sometimes , If i remove the Assigned to USer A filter then the test cases returned are correct but are for all the assigned users.

testsuite.name: Filter by Execution STATUS = NOT RUN
testsuite.details:
Not run is an special execution status, because NO RECORD IS WRITTEN into DB. For this reason is much more easier to written wrong queries.

Special care has to be put on this kind of test cases

testcase.name: Filter by Execution status NOT RUN - 1B0P
testcase.summary:
Not run is an special execution status, because NO RECORD IS WRITTEN into DB. For this reason is much more easier to written wrong queries.

Special care has to be put on this kind of test cases
testcase.preconditions: Test Plan has to have:  Just One Build (1B), No Platforms (0P)

step.actions:
Create Test Project -> ISSUE 5131
Create Test Plan-> Test Plan 1 - NO PLATFORMS
Create Build -> 501122
Create user -> user1 , role->senior tester
Create Test suite A and test cases TC1 to TC5
Add test cases and assign test cases to user1
Login with user1 credential
Go to -> Test execution
Mark Test case TC1 as Passed
Go to filters-> Select in Results->"Not Run" filter
step.expectedresults: It should display 4 test cases as not run

testcase.name: Filter by Execution status NOT RUN - 1B1P
testcase.summary:
Not run is an special execution status, because NO RECORD IS WRITTEN into DB. For this reason is much more easier to written wrong queries.

Special care has to be put on this kind of test cases
testcase.preconditions: Test Plan has to have:  Just One Build (1B),  Just One Platform (1P)

step.actions:
Create Test Project -> ISSUE 5131


Create Test Plan-> Test Plan 2 - ON" PLATFORM


Create Build -> 501122


Create Platform -> VxWorks


Assigne Plaform to Test Plan


Create user -> user1 , role->senior tester


Create Test suite A and test cases TC1 to TC5


Add test cases and assign test cases to user1


Login with user1 credential


Go to -> Test execution


Mark Test case TC1 as Passed


Go to filters-> Select in Results->"Not Run" filter
step.expectedresults: It should display 4 test cases as not run

testcase.name: Filter by Test Case ID
testcase.summary: Test using the test case ID filter

step.actions:
Create Test Project -> Project A ->Give Prefix of test cases as "QA"
Create Test Plan-> Test Plan 1 -> NO PLATFORMS
Create Build -> 501122
Create user -> user1 , role->senior tester
Create Test suite A and add test cases TC1 to TC5 sequentially.
Add test cases and assign test cases to user1
Login with user1 credential
Go to -> Test execution
Mark Test case TC1 as Passed
Go to filters-> Select "Test Case ID" filter -> Enter Value 5
step.expectedresults: The Test case five should be displayed. the test case ID of the fifth test case should be QA-5

step.actions: Once the test case is filtered. Click on "Reset Filter"
step.expectedresults: The filtered test cases should be cleared and whole left tree with all test cases should be displayed.

testcase.name: To test "Test Case Title filter " in Test Execution
testcase.summary: This test case is to test if exact test case title is given in filter is working fine or not

step.actions:
Create Test Project -> Project A
Create Test Plan-> Test Plan 1->NO PLATFORMS
Create Build -> 501122
Create user -> user1 , role->senior tester
Create Test suite A

Create Test case 1 ->  with test case title as " Test case to test the filters"

Create Test case 2-> with test case title as " Test case 2"

Create test case 3 -> with test case title as "Test case to test the testcases"

Add test cases and assign test cases to user1
Login with user1 credential
Go to -> Test execution
Mark Test case 1 as Passed

Go to filters-> Select-> Test case title filter-> give "test case"
step.expectedresults: As all the three test cases has test case in them all the three test cases should be filtered.

step.actions: Reset the filters. And now give filter as "2"
step.expectedresults: Only the second test case should be displayed.

step.actions: Reset the filter and now give the filter as "filter"
step.expectedresults: Only the first test case should be displayed.

testcase.name: Filter by Test Suites
testcase.summary: Filter by Test Suite

step.actions:
Create Test Project -> Project A
Create Test Plan-> Test Plan 1->NO PLATFORMS
Create Build -> 501122
Create user -> user1 , role->senior tester
Create Test suite A-> Test cases TC 1 to TC5

Create Test Suite B-> Test Cases TC6 to TC8

Add and  Assign all test cases to user1


Login with user1 credential


Go to -> Test execution

Mark TC 1 and TC 8 as Passed

Go to filters-> Select-> Test Suite Filter -> Test Suite A
step.expectedresults: All test cases irrespective of status pass/fail/block  in Test Suite  A should be displayed

testcase.name: Create Test Plan - No conflict
testcase.summary: If a Test Plan does not exist in the list of Test Plans, adding the Test Plan should not cause a conflict error message to appear to the right of the Test Plan name field.
testcase.preconditions: A Test Plan with the same name does not exist in the list of Test Plans.

step.actions: Click the Project tab.
step.expectedresults: The Project landing page.

step.actions: Click the Test Plan Management link.
step.expectedresults: A list of Test Plans.

step.actions: Click the Create button.
step.expectedresults: The add new Test Plan form is visible.

step.actions: Enter a Test Plan name that does not exist in the list of Test Plans.
step.expectedresults: An error message noting a conflict does not appear to the right of the name field.

step.actions: Enter a description in the Description field.
Click the checkbox to the right of the Active field.
step.expectedresults: A checkmark is visible in the checkbox.

step.actions: Click the checkbox to the right of the Public field.
step.expectedresults: A checkmack is visible in the checkbox.

step.actions: Click the Create button.
step.expectedresults: A Test Plan with your specified name is visible in the list of Test Plans.

keyword.name: Test Plan
keyword.notes: Any feature that exercise the Test Plan test area.

testcase.name: Attach any file to a Test Plan
testcase.summary:
In the issue 3987, we added the feature to upload attachments to test plans.

As administrator or leader, a user can now attach any file (text file, image, etc) to a test plan.

No warnings should appear in the event log viewer.
testcase.preconditions: Administrator, leader or some other role with permission to manage test plans.

step.actions: Create a new test plan
step.expectedresults: A new test plan is created

step.actions:
Select just created test plan and edit it (is only way to access the attachment feature)

 Upload an attachment
step.expectedresults: The screen is reloaded when the popup is closed, and the attachment is displayed, with a delete button in the right side.

step.actions: Verify that no errors appeared in the apache log or in event viewer.
step.expectedresults: No warning logs (specially regarding uninitialized variables)

keyword.name: Test Plan
keyword.notes: Any feature that exercise the Test Plan test area.

testcase.name: Test plan - Delete attachment
testcase.summary:
In the issue 3987, we added the feature to upload attachments to test plans.

A user with rights to create test plans can now attach any file (text file, image, etc) to a test plan.

No warnings should appear in the event log viewer. And if a test plan is deleted, the attachments of this test plan must be deleted as well.
testcase.preconditions: Administrator, leader or some other role with permission to manage test plans.

step.actions: Create a new test plan
step.expectedresults: A new test plan is created

step.actions:
Select just created test plan and edit it (is only way to access the attachment feature)

 Upload an attachment
step.expectedresults: The screen is reloaded when the popup is closed, and the attachment is displayed, with a delete button in the right side.

step.actions: Verify that no errors appeared in the apache log or in event viewer.
step.expectedresults: No warning logs (specially regarding uninitialized variables)

step.actions: After taking notes of the test plan ID, we delete the test plan, and check that in the upload area (in the server), the attachments were deleted as well (you will have to use the test plan ID).
step.expectedresults: Attachments are gone.

keyword.name: Test Plan
keyword.notes: Any feature that exercise the Test Plan test area.

testcase.name: Create Test Plan - AS COPY - NO ATTACHMENTS
testcase.summary: Create a test plan copied from another test plan with no attachments. Both must have no attachments.

An existing test plan with no attachments.

step.expectedresults: A new test plan is created, with no attachments.

testcase.name: Create Test Plan - AS COPY - WITH ATTACHMENTS BUT DO NOT COPY ATTACHMENTS
testcase.summary: Copy a test plan from another test plan with attachments, but do not check the option to copy attachments. This must leave the new test plan with no attachments, while the existing test plan remains the same, with attachments.
testcase.preconditions:
User with rights to create test plans.

An existing test plan with attachments.

step.actions: Create a new test plan, and check the option to copy from an existing test plan that contains attachments. Uncheck the option to copy attachments.
step.expectedresults: A new test plan is created. While the existing test plan contains attachments, the new test plan must have no attachments.

testcase.name: Assignment of execution to user (with platforms)
testcase.summary: Test execute assignment to user
testcase.preconditions:
Test plan with a least one test case.

At least two users.

At least two platforms connected to the test plan

step.actions: Assign a test case on platform A to a user A and the same test case but platform B to user B
step.expectedresults: Test case platform A is assigned to user A and platform B is assigned to user B

step.actions: Reassign a test case to another user
step.expectedresults: Test case is assigned to the other user

step.actions: Unassign the test case
step.expectedresults: The test case is unassigned

testcase.name: Assignment of execution to user [2]
testcase.summary: Test execute assignment to user
testcase.preconditions:
Test plan with a least one test case.

At least two users.

No platforms in use for the test plan.

step.actions: Assign a test case to a user
step.expectedresults: Test case is assigned to the user

step.actions: Reassign a test case to another user
step.expectedresults: Test case is assigned to the other user

step.actions: Unassign the test case
step.expectedresults: The test case is unassigned
